comment:
Linear Programming:A mathematical method used to determine the best outcome in a given mathematical model for a set of linear relationships.
Objective Function:In linear programming, the function that needs to be optimized (maximized or minimized). In this case, the objective function is to maximize profits.
Constraints:Restrictions or limitations that must be satisfied in a linear programming problem. In this case, the constraints are the available amounts of regular candy and sour candy.
